trans-unit.source: Exposes <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.TextElement"></xref> types to [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uiautomation](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-uiautomation-md.md)].
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.TextElementAutomationPeer"></xref> class.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.TextElement"></xref> that is associated with this <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.TextElementAutomationPeer"></xref>.

Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.Rect"></xref> representing the bounding rectangle of the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.TextElement"></xref> that is associated with this <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.TextElementAutomationPeer"></xref>.
Called by <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetBoundingRectangle*>.

The <xref href="System.Windows.Rect"></xref> that contains the coordinates of the element, or <xref:System.Windows.Rect.Empty*> if the element is not a <xref href="System.Windows.Interop.HwndSource"></xref> and a <xref href="System.Windows.PresentationSource"></xref>.

Gets the collection of child elements of the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.TextElement"></xref> that is associated with this <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.TextElementAutomationPeer"></xref>.
Called by <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetChildren*>.
Because <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.DocumentAutomationPeer> provides access to its content through <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPattern>, this method always returns `null`.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.

Gets a <xref href="System.Windows.Point"></xref> that represents the clickable space that is on the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.TextElement"></xref> that is associated with this <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.TextElementAutomationPeer"></xref>.
Called by <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetClickablePoint*>.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Point"></xref> on the element that allows a click.

The point values are (<xref:System.Double.NaN>, <xref:System.Double.NaN>) if the element is not a <xref href="System.Windows.Interop.HwndSource"></xref> and a <xref href="System.Windows.PresentationSource"></xref>.

Gets a value that indicates whether <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.TextElement"></xref> that is associated with this <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.TextElementAutomationPeer"></xref> is off of the screen.
Called by <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.IsOffscreen*>.
This property does not indicate whether the element is visible.
In some circumstances, the element can be on the screen but still not be visible.
An example is an element that is obscured by other elements.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the element is not on the screen; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
